intro: Eriocaulon aequinoctiale, commonly known as the equinoctial flat sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Eriocaulon aequinoctiale is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic biodiversity.
